name: CKEDITOR.dom.window
doc:
Represents a DOM window.

var document = new CKEDITOR.dom.window( window );

members.doc:
The native DOM object represented by this class instance.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.$.nodeType ); // '1'
members.short_doc: The native DOM object represented by this class instance. ...

members.name: constructor
members.doc: Creates a window class instance.

params.name: domWindow
params.doc: A native DOM window.

members.short_doc: Creates a window class instance. ...

members.name: capture
members.doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target.
members.short_doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target. ...

members.name: clearCustomData
members.doc: Removes any data stored on this object. To avoid memory leaks we must assure that there are no references left after the object is no longer needed.
members.short_doc: Removes any data stored on this object. ...

members.name: define
members.doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name.

params.name: name
params.doc: The event name

params.name: meta

properties.name: errorProof
properties.doc: Whether the event firing should catch error thrown from a per listener call.

members.short_doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name. ...

members.name: equals
members.doc:
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

var doc = new CKEDITOR.dom.document( document );
alert( doc.equals( CKEDITOR.document ) );   // true
alert( doc == CKEDITOR.document );          // false

params.name: object
params.doc: The object to compare with the current object.

members.short_doc: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object. ...

members.name: fire
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object. All registered listeners are called at this point.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );             // Both listeners are called.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.data );                    // 'Example'
} );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent', 'Example' );

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The event name to fire.

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A boolean indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc: Fires an specific event in the object. ...

members.name: fireOnce
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners registered to that event. The same listeners are not called again on successive calls of it or of fire.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // Above listener called.
someObject.fireOnce( 'someEvent' );     // Above listener called.
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // No listeners called.

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The event name to fire.

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A booloan indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners
registered to that event. ...

members.name: focus
members.doc:
Moves the selection focus to this window.

var win = new CKEDITOR.dom.window( window );
win.focus();
members.short_doc: Moves the selection focus to this window. ...

members.name: getCustomData
members.doc:
Gets the value set to a data slot in this object.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.getCustomData( 'hasCustomData' ) );      // e.g. 'true'
alert( element.getCustomData( 'nonExistingKey' ) );     // null

params.name: key
params.doc: The key used to identify the data slot.

return.name: return
return.doc: This value set to the data slot.

members.short_doc: Gets the value set to a data slot in this object. ...

members.name: getFrame
members.doc: Gets the frame element containing this window context.

return.name: return
return.doc: The frame element or null if not in a frame context.

members.short_doc: Gets the frame element containing this window context. ...

members.name: getPrivate
members.doc:
Get the private _ object which is bound to the native DOM object using getCustomData.

var elementA = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( nativeElement );
elementA.getPrivate().value = 1;
...
var elementB = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( nativeElement );
elementB.getPrivate().value; // 1
members.short_doc:
Get the private _ object which is bound to the native
DOM object using getCustomData. ...

members.name: getScrollPosition
members.doc:
Gets the current position of the window's scroll.

var win = new CKEDITOR.dom.window( window );
var pos = win.getScrollPosition();
alert( pos.x );
alert( pos.y );

return.name: return
return.doc: An object with the x and y properties containing the scroll position.

members.short_doc: Gets the current position of the window's scroll. ...

members.name: getUniqueId
members.doc:
Gets an ID that can be used to identify this DOM object in the running session.

Note: This method does not work on text nodes prior to Internet Explorer 9.
members.short_doc:
Gets an ID that can be used to identify this DOM object in
the running session. ...

members.name: getViewPaneSize
members.doc:
Gets the width and height of this window's viewable area.

var win = new CKEDITOR.dom.window( window );
var size = win.getViewPaneSize();
alert( size.width );
alert( size.height );

return.name: return
return.doc: An object with the width and height properties containing the size.

members.short_doc: Gets the width and height of this window's viewable area. ...

members.name: hasListeners
members.doc:
Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'someEvent' ) );    // true
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'noEvent' ) );      // false

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The event name.

members.short_doc: Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event. ...

members.name: on
members.doc:
Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == someObject );        // true
} );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == anotherObject );     // true
}, anotherObject );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.listenerData );        // 'Example'
}, null, 'Example' );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );                       // 2nd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 100 );      // 3rd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 1 );        // 1st called

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The event name to which listen.

params.name: listenerFunction
params.doc: The function listening to the event. A single CKEDITOR.eventInfo object instanced is passed to this function containing all the event data.

params.name: scopeObj
params.doc: The object used to scope the listener call (the this object). If omitted, the current object is used.

params.name: listenerData
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.listenerData when calling the listener.

params.name: priority
params.doc: The listener priority. Lower priority listeners are called first. Listeners with the same priority value are called in registration order.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object containing the removeListener function, which can be used to remove the listener at any time.

members.short_doc: Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object. ...

members.name: once
members.doc:
Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing.

@see CKEDITOR.event.on
members.short_doc: Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing. ...

members.name: removeAllListeners
members.doc:
Removes any listener set on this object.

To avoid memory leaks we must assure that there are no references left after the object is no longer needed.
members.short_doc: Removes any listener set on this object. ...

members.name: removeCustomData
members.doc: Removes the value in data slot under given key.

params.name: key

members.short_doc: Removes the value in data slot under given key. ...

members.name: removeListener
members.doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified event. No errors are thrown if the listener has not been registered previously.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener called.
someObject.removeListener( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener not called.

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The event name.

params.name: listenerFunction
params.doc: The listener function to unregister.

members.short_doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified
event. ...

members.name: setCustomData
members.doc:
Sets a data slot value for this object. These values are shared by all instances pointing to that same DOM object.

Note: The created data slot is only guarantied to be available on this unique dom node, thus any wish to continue access it from other element clones (either created by clone node or from innerHtml) will fail, for such usage, please use CKEDITOR.dom.element.setAttribute instead.

Note: This method does not work on text nodes prior to Internet Explorer 9.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
element.setCustomData( 'hasCustomData', true );

params.name: key
params.doc: A key used to identify the data slot.

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to set to the data slot.

members.short_doc: Sets a data slot value for this object. ...
